column5: Gentlemen I always pick up some long grained wild rice up in Canada. Does anyone have a good recipe

Two of my favorites Wild rice soup Ingredients: * 1/2 cup wild rice * 1/2 cup shredded carrots * 6 cups water * 4 cups chicken stock * 1/2 cup diced celery Cooking: 1. Rinse wild rice. 2. Cook in 6 cups water until plump and tender, drain. 3. Set aside. 4. Combine chicken stock, carrots, onions and celery. 5. Bring to a boil, then simmer and cook until vegetables are tender. 6. Add cooked wild rice. 7. Makes 4 servings. Lake Itasca Douglas Lodge Wild Rice Hot Dish Ingredients: * 1/2 Cup finely diced Celery * 1/2 Cup finely diced Onion * 1-1/2 cup wild rice * 2 (10oz. cans) cream of mushroom soup * 1 (10oz. can) cream of celery soup * 1 (4oz. can) sliced water chestnuts (optional) * Well browned hamburger * Salt, pepper, & garlic to taste Cooking: 1. Sauté the celery and onion in oil. 2. Add the browned hamburger. 3. Rinse wild rice well and cook in 7 to 8 cups water until done at least 20 minutes. 4. Mix all ingredients together and add the soups and water chestnuts. 5. Season to taste. 6. Bake at 325° for 1 to 1-1/2 hours.
I make this soup every Fall and it's fairly easy to make and tastes great. The wild rice in it gives it that little something extra. Try it. https://www.emerils.com/121104/smoke...wild-rice-soup
